results.title: Asia: a continental overview
results.brief_description: Examines the principle physical regions of Asia in terms of natural resources and human use. Gives a picture of the wide range of living conditions on this largest and most populous of the continents and emphasizes the many changes taking place in centuries-old patterns of life. No other credits available.

results.title: As old as the hills
results.brief_description: A history of oil from dinosaur days to the sinking of a present-day oil well. Shows how oil was formed over one hundred million years ago as a result of the decomposition of marine and plant life, and explains how rock movements over the ages have trapped the oil in porous layers in the earth’s crust.

results.title: Artists must live
results.creator_credit: John Read, John Elliot, BBC-TV and Great Britain Arts Council
results.brief_description: Explores the relationship between the artist and his patron. Shows the problems facing contemporary artists and the opportunities offered by institutional and industrial sponsors, the modern successors to wealthy private patrons. Painters and sculptors featured in this film include John Piper, Keith Vaughan, Patrick Heron, Ridrigo Moynihan, Evor Hitchens, Reg Butler, Clifford Ellis, J.M.W. Turner, Jacob Epstein and Henry Moore. The narrator is the well-known art critic Basil Taylor; the film includes scenes at the Slade School, the Bath Academy, the Tate Gallery, and other centres of art in Britain.

results.title: The Artificial kidney
results.brief_description: The principle of the artificial kidney was known as early as the 1920’s, but only in later years has it been possible to use it in chronic renal diseases where the kidney has completely, or very largely, ceased to function. A Swedish girl who receives treatment from the artificial kidney machine discusses the problems she faces and the possibility of a kidney transplantation. No other credits available.

results.title: Artificial jewellery from Neugablonz
results.brief_description: The history of the town of Neugablonz and the processes of the manufacture of artificial jewellery, and the training of workers in the industry.

results.title: Artificial insemination of cattle
results.creator_credit: Tom Stobart and Dartington Hall Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film illustrates, by means of actual scenes and animated diagrams, the process of the artificial insemination of cattle, stresses the importance of the practice to stockbreeders and shows just how a centre for this purpose is set up and run.

results.title: Art to the people
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the process engravers and the printers who produce each year the calendar of reproductions of wining entries in the Dunlop Art Contest. The film illustrates all stages in the production of the calendar from the photographing of the original material by the process engraver to the final wrapping of the printed article. The film also illustrates the opportunities for apprenticeship in the printing industry.

results.title: Art of hand screen printing
results.creator_credit: Albert Lane, Stanley Murphy and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: The evolution of hand printed silk from the designer’s original sketch, taken from nature, through the many processes until the fabric is completed. Shows in detail the transfer of the photographic copy to the screen, mixing of dyes and the steam treating of the fabric.
